confidence.notes: Sources include UN, IMF, think tanks; data partly missing.

key_takeaways.claim: The DRC’s vast critical mineral wealth (e.g. ∼70% of global cobalt) has not translated into prosperity due to chronic conflict and weak governance.
Armed groups (e.g. M23) backed by neighboring states (Rwanda, Uganda) fuel violence and economic disruption, deterring investment.
Regionally, the DRC is a trade and transit hub (in SADC and COMESA) with major corridors (e.g. Durban-Kolwezi) and is now part of AfCFTA/EAC, making its stability a continental concern.

resource_endowment.summary: The DRC possesses vast mineral wealth (copper, cobalt, gold, coltan, etc.) and dominates global cobalt supply, but this has not ensured economic development.

notable_resources.name: cobalt
notable_resources.role: World’s largest producer (72% of global output in 2021), key for EV batteries

notable_resources.name: copper
notable_resources.role: Major global supplier (4th largest producer, ∼8% of world output in 2021)

notable_resources.name: coltan/tantalum
notable_resources.role: Significant share of global supply (∼30% of global coltan from Great Lakes region, critical for electronics)

notable_resources.name: gold
notable_resources.role: Notable gold production (important export and artisanal economy)

geopolitical_risk_why_high.summary: Persistent armed conflict, weak governance, and regional interventions make the DRC highly unstable despite its resource wealth.

drivers.mechanism: Ongoing violence (e.g. M23, ADF) undermines security, displaces civilians, and blocks investment.

details.point: M23’s 2025 offensive captured Goma, killing hundreds and displacing ~1M people (CFR)
Eastern DRC has endured decades of conflict with millions of casualties (RUSI)

drivers.mechanism: Corruption and weak rule-of-law in mining fuel elite capture and conflict over resources.

details.point: Mining sector governance is poor (RGI 36/100) and regulations are poorly enforced (NRGI)
Budget processes bypass normal channels, reflecting opaque spending (IMF 2019)

drivers.mechanism: Neighboring conflicts and interventions exacerbate DRC instability (refugees, foreign military involvement).

details.point: Rwanda and Uganda back rebel groups (e.g. ~4,000 Rwandan troops with M23) (Atlantic Council)
DRC hosts ~522k refugees from neighbors; ~1.2M Congolese refugees abroad (UNHCR)

drivers.mechanism: Shadow trade in minerals and other goods finances armed groups and deprives state revenue.

details.point: Militias tax and control mining, exporting ~150–120 tonnes of coltan monthly to Rwanda (7–10% of global supply) (Atlantic Council)
Conflict-driven mixing of legal/illegal minerals launders supply chains (Atlantic Council)

drivers.mechanism: Pervasive poverty and poor infrastructure limit development and leave the economy vulnerable.

details.point: Economy is largely informal with underdeveloped transport (e.g. Matadi port is shallow, requiring use of foreign ports) (Ecofin)
Essential services (health, education) are underfunded and salaries are low (IMF 2019)

drivers.mechanism: Contentious elections and limited state capacity erode legitimacy and order.

details.point: President Tshisekedi’s 2023 re-election was controversial, stoking unrest and undermining trust in institutions (RUSI)

economic.role: A large, resource-rich economy central to regional trade (member of SADC, COMESA) but with low value-added diversification.
trade_links: SADC North-South Corridor (Durban-Kolwezi) carries ~60% of SADC trade (SADC)
Lobito Corridor (Angola-DRC) and corridor via Tanzania connect DRC to Atlantic and Indian Ocean ports (Ecofin)

security.role: Key theater for African peacekeeping and a focus of regional security concerns.
alliances_and_missions: UN peacekeeping (MONUSCO) deployed since 1999, supported by an EAC Regional Force (Kenya, Tanzania, Rwanda, S. Africa) in eastern DRC (CFR)

diplomacy.role: Influential in Central African and wider African affairs (AU, joined AfCFTA and EAC in 2022).

global_expectations.what_world_wants: Secure, stable, and ethically sourced supply of cobalt, copper, etc. (essential for EV batteries and electronics).
risks_to_expectation: Active conflicts in mining areas disrupt production (Atlantic Council)
Weak governance and smuggling undermine responsible sourcing (Atlantic Council)

global_expectations.what_world_wants: An end to long-running conflicts and a stable, effective government to ease humanitarian crisis.
risks_to_expectation: Persistent militia violence and foreign-backed rebellions (CFR, RUSI)

global_expectations.what_world_wants: Major infrastructure projects (roads, ports, power) to unlock economic potential.
risks_to_expectation: Capacity constraints and high costs (e.g. port upgrades) (Ecofin)
Security risks and governance issues may deter investors

global_expectations.what_world_wants: Improved transparency, anti-corruption measures, and rule-of-law, especially in resource sectors.
risks_to_expectation: Entrenched elites and weak institutions may resist reforms (IMF, NRGI)
